instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3209A: What is 820-3209A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Chime, then fan start going max, no image
threads.message: Hi, I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, when I turn it on, I hear a chime, but there's no image, and then the fan start going full speed, must I check all the power rail ? or it is a known common problem ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Chime, then fan start going max, no image
threads.message: fyi, the cpu does generate a bit of warm, I cannot do pram ( it doesnt chime for the second time , but i can reset smc ),  there's usb activity ( the light on mouse is present )

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Chime, then fan start going max, no image
threads.message:
Try to confirm USB activity with OSX pendrive.
If Link LED flashes, there is activity for sure.
Also test for external video.

Missing image and backlight at same time?
Test the board alone, without LIO flex connected.
